poem:
The Currency of Secrets  

In the Commons  
questions twist,  
an urgent tangle—  
a whisper, a sidestep,  
where truth is shaved—  
"5% less" they say—  
but who measures  
intangibles, the slip  
of China's scrutiny  
in cold British light?  
Here, a minister  
balances words;  
we count shadows  
on a page.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Government to respond to Commons urgent question on China spy case witness statements – UK politics live 9.56am BST Minister says DPP must explain why CPS thought China spy evidence was '5% less' than needed Stephen Kinnock, the care minister, was the government spokesperson on the media this morning. As Eleni Courea reports, asked about the China spy case witness statements, he said it was up to the CPS to explain why the prosecution was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
